verses.text: And it came to pass at that time , that Judah went down from his brethren , and turned in to a certain Adullamite , whose name \add was\add* Hirah.
And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite , whose name \add was\add* Shuah ; and he took her , and went in unto her.
And she conceived , and bare a son ; and he called his name Er.
And she conceived again, and bare a son ; and she called his name Onan.
And she yet again conceived , and bare a son ; and called his name Shelah : and he was at Chezib , when she bare him.
And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn , whose name \add was\add* Tamar.

And Er , Judah’s firstborn , was wicked in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* slew him.
And Judah said unto Onan , Go in unto thy brother’s wife , and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.

And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother’s wife , that he spilled \add it\add* on the ground , lest that he should give seed to his brother.
And the thing which he did displeased the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: wherefore he slew him also.\f + \fr 38.10 \ft displeased…: Heb. was evil in the eyes of the Lord\f*

Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law , Remain a widow at thy father’s house , till Shelah my son be grown : for he said , Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren \add did\add*. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father’s house. \p

¶ And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah’s wife died ; and Judah was comforted , and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath , he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.\f + \fr 38.12 \ft in process…: Heb. the days were multiplied\f*
And it was told Tamar , saying , Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.

And she put her widow’s garments off from her, and covered her with a vail , and wrapped herself , and sat in an open place , which \add is\add* by the way to Timnath ; for she saw that Shelah was grown , and she was not given unto him to wife.\f + \fr 38.14 \ft an open…: Heb. the door of eyes, or, of Enajim\f*
When Judah saw her , he thought her \add to be\add* an harlot ; because she had covered her face.

And he turned unto her by the way , and said , Go to , I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she \add was\add* his daughter in law.) And she said , What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
And he said , I will send \add thee\add* a kid from the flock. And she said , Wilt thou give \add me\add* a pledge , till thou send \add it\add*?\f + \fr 38.17 \ft a kid: Heb. a kid of the goats\f*

And he said , What pledge shall I give thee? And she said , Thy signet , and thy bracelets , and thy staff that \add is\add* in thine hand. And he gave \add it\add* her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
And she arose , and went away , and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite , to receive \add his\add* pledge from the woman’s hand : but he found her not.

Then he asked the men of that place , saying , Where \add is\add* the harlot , that \add was\add* openly by the way side ? And they said , There was no harlot in this \add place\add*.\f + \fr 38.21 \ft openly: or, in Enajim\f*
And he returned to Judah , and said , I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said , \add that\add* there was no harlot in this \add place\add*.
And Judah said , Let her take \add it\add* to her, lest we be shamed : behold, I sent this kid , and thou hast not found her.\f + \fr 38.23 \ft be shamed: Heb. become a contempt\f* \p

¶ And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah , saying , Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot ; and also, behold, she \add is\add* with child by whoredom. And Judah said , Bring her forth , and let her be burnt.

When she \add was\add* brought forth , she sent to her father in law , saying , By the man , whose these \add are, am\add* I with child : and she said , Discern , I pray thee, whose \add are\add* these, the signet , and bracelets , and staff.
And Judah acknowledged \add them\add*, and said , She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more. \p
¶ And it came to pass in the time of her travail , that, behold, twins \add were\add* in her womb.
And it came to pass, when she travailed , that \add the one\add* put out \add his\add* hand : and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread , saying , This came out first.

And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand , that, behold, his brother came out : and she said , How hast thou broken forth ? \add this\add* breach \add be\add* upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.\f + \fr 38.29 \ft How hast…: or, Wherefore hast thou made this breach against thee?\f*\f + \fr 38.29 \ft Pharez: that is A breach\f*
And afterward came out his brother , that had the scarlet thread upon his hand : and his name was called Zarah.
